Key Match Events: The Philadelphia Phillies beat the Houston Astros 5-0 on Tuesday night.
The Phillies jumped out to a 4-0 lead in the third inning.
The Phillies added an insurance run in the seventh inning in an amusing way.
With two outs and runners on the corners, Phillies third baseman Alec Bohm hit a towering fly ball into shallow centerfield.
Second baseman Jose Altuve, shortstop Jeremy Pena, and centerfielder Jake Meyers converged on the ball as it fell safely to the ground.
The ball appeared to hit both Pena and Meyers in the feet as they went down.
Left fielder Mauricio Dubon ran in to pick the ball up.
Bohm was credited with a double, and the Astros escaped without an error.
